message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.ST, cs.CE 

The paper proposes a new method for probability calibration of classifiers, which is a common problem in machine learning. The method involves using logistic model trees to identify regions of the input space where different calibration models are learned. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) as well as artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves statistical modeling and analysis, which could place it in the sub-categories of data mining (cs.DM) and statistics (cs.ST). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the method to classification tasks, which could place it in the sub-category of computational engineering (cs.CE).
